net.openhft.chronicle.bytes

Interface BytesIn<Underlying>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    StreamingCommon<Bytes<Underlying>>, StreamingDataInput<Bytes<Underlying>>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Bytes<Underlying>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBytes, HexDumpBytes, MappedBytes, NativeBytes, UncheckedBytes, UncheckedNativeBytes, VanillaBytes

    public interface BytesIn<Underlying>
extends StreamingDataInput<Bytes<Underlying>>

default MethodReader bytesMethodReader(Object... objects)
        Reads messages from this tails as methods. It returns a BooleanSupplier which returns
        Parameters:
        objects - which implement the methods serialized to the file.
        Returns:
        a reader which will read one Excerpt at a time

      • parseBoolean

        @Nullable
default Boolean parseBoolean(@NotNull
                                       StopCharTester tester)
        Return true or false, or null if it could not be detected as true or false. Case is not important

        false: f, false, n, no, 0

        true: t, true, y, yes, 1

        Parameters:
        tester - to detect the end of the text.
        Returns:
        true, false, or null if neither.

      • parseDouble

        default double parseDouble()
                    throws BufferUnderflowException
        parse text as a double decimal. The terminating character is consumed.

        The number of decimal places can be retrieved with lastDecimalPlaces()

        Returns:
        a double.
        Throws:
        BufferUnderflowException

      • parseLongDecimal

        default long parseLongDecimal()
                       throws BufferUnderflowException
        Parse the significant digits of a decimal number.

        The number of decimal places can be retrieved with lastDecimalPlaces()

        Returns:
        the significant digits
        Throws:
        BufferUnderflowException

        Skip text until a terminating character is reached.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • addressForRead

        long addressForRead(long offset)
             throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                    BufferUnderflowException
        Obtain the underlying addressForRead. This is for expert users only.
        Parameters:
        offset - within this buffer. addressForRead(start()) is the actual addressForRead of the first byte.
        Returns:
        the underlying addressForRead of the buffer
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the underlying buffer is on the heap
        BufferUnderflowException - if the offset is before the start() or the after the capacity()

      • addressForWrite

        long addressForWrite(long offset)
              throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                     BufferOverflowException
        Obtain the underlying addressForRead. This is for expert users only.
        Parameters:
        offset - within this buffer. addressForRead(start()) is the actual addressForRead of the first byte.
        Returns:
        the underlying addressForRead of the buffer
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the underlying buffer is on the heap
        BufferOverflowException - if the offset is before the start() or the after the capacity()

                          int expected,
                          int value)
                   throws BufferOverflowException

        Parameters:
        offset - to perform CAS
        expected - value
        value - to set
        Returns:
        true, if successful.
